13  ## Tests if the formatted log messages are emitted
14  @patch('rospy.loginfo')
15  @patch('rospy.logwarn')
16  @patch('rospy.logerr')
17  def testFormattedLog(self, logerr, logwarn, loginfo):
18  cu = CloudUploader()
19  cu.formatted_log('i', "test")
20  loginfo.assert_called_with("[BBU] test")
21  cu.formatted_log('w', "test2")
22  logwarn.assert_called_with("[BBU] test2")
23  cu.formatted_log('e', "test3")
24  logerr.assert_called_with("[BBU] test3")
25  cu.formatted_log('something else', "test4")
26  logerr.assert_called_with("[BBU] test4")

32  assert cu.currentTask is None

36  def testNs(self, get_name):
37  cu = CloudUploader()
38  assert cu._ns("test") == "xxx/test"

40  assert cu._ns("test3") == "xxx/test3"

42  def patched_get_param(key, def_val):
43  return '{0}:{1}'.format(key, def_val)

45  def patched_ns(self, key):
46  return "/ns/" + key

48  ## Tests if the config is loaded correctly
49  @patch('rospy.logerr')
50  @patch('rospy.logwarn')
51  @patch('rospy.get_param', side_effect=patched_get_param)
52  @patch('src.ros_node_base.RosNodeBase._ns', side_effect=patched_ns)
53  def testLoadConfig(self, ns, get_param, logwarn, logerr):
54  cu = CloudUploader()
55  cu.load_config()
56  #get_param.assert_any_call()
57  assert cu.ftp_host == "/ns/ftp_host:None"
58  assert cu.ftp_password == "/ns/ftp_password:None"
59  assert cu.ftp_username == "/ns/ftp_username:None"
60  assert cu.smtp_host == "/ns/smtp_host:None"
61  assert cu.smtp_username == "/ns/smtp_username:None"
62  assert cu.smtp_password == "/ns/smtp_password:None"
63  assert cu.smtp_connection_mode == "/ns/smtp_connection_mode:tls"
64  assert cu.smtp_port == "/ns/smtp_port:25"
65  assert cu.archive_path == "/ns/archive_path:None"
66  assert cu.email_toaddress == "/ns/email_toaddress:None"
67  assert cu.email_subject == "/ns/email_subject:New log file uploaded"
68 
69  logwarn.assert_not_called()
70  logerr.assert_not_called()

72  def patched_get_param_missing(key, def_val):
73  if key == TestCloudUploader.missing_key:
74  return def_val
75  else:
76  return '{0}:{1}'.format(key, def_val)

78  ## Tests if the missing recommended config items are handled correctly
79  @patch('sys.exit')
80  @patch('rospy.logerr')
81  @patch('rospy.logwarn')
82  @patch('rospy.get_param', side_effect=patched_get_param_missing)
83  @patch('src.ros_node_base.RosNodeBase._ns', side_effect=patched_ns)
84  def testLoadConfig_RecommendedMissing(self, ns, get_param, logwarn, logerr, _exit):
85  TestCloudUploader.missing_key = "/ns/smtp_host"
86  cu = CloudUploader()
87  cu.load_config()
88 
89  logwarn.assert_called_with('[BBU] Recommended config item not set: smtp_host')
90  logerr.assert_not_called()
91  _exit.assert_not_called()
92 
93  logwarn.reset_mock()
94  TestCloudUploader.missing_key = "/ns/ftp_host"
95  cu.load_config()
96 
97  calls = [call('[BBU] Mandatory config item not set: ftp_host'), call('[BBU] Mandatory config item(s) missing, exiting.')]
98  logerr.assert_has_calls(calls)
99  logwarn.assert_not_called()
100  _exit.assert_called_once()

102  ## Tests if the email sending works properly
103  @patch('rospy.logwarn')
104  @patch('smtplib.SMTP.__init__', return_value = None)
105  @patch('smtplib.SMTP.ehlo')
106  @patch('smtplib.SMTP.starttls')
107  @patch('smtplib.SMTP.login')
108  @patch('smtplib.SMTP.sendmail')
109  def testSendEmail(self, sendmail, login, starttls, ehlo, smtp, logwarn):
110  cu = CloudUploader()
111  cu.email_toaddress = "email_to"
112  cu.smtp_username = "smtpuser"
113  cu.smtp_host = "smtphost"
114  cu.smtp_port = "smtpport"
115  cu.smtp_password = "smtppass"
116  cu.send_mail("bag", "topic", "value", "sub", "body")
117  logwarn.assert_not_called()
118  assert ehlo.call_count == 2
119  starttls.assert_called_once()
120  login.assert_called_with("smtpuser","smtppass")
121  smtp.assert_called_with("smtphost", "smtpport")
122 
123  #test the warning messages, if an exception happens
124  del cu.smtp_host
125  cu.send_mail("bag", "topic", "value", "sub", "body")
126  assert logwarn.call_count == 2

130  @patch('ftplib.FTP.quit')
131  @patch('ftplib.FTP.storbinary')
132  @patch('__builtin__.open')
133  @patch('ftplib.FTP.__init__', return_value = None)
134  def testUploadAndNotify(self, init, open, stor, quit, send):
135  cu = CloudUploader()
136  RosNodeBase._recommended_missing = False
137  cu.ftp_host = "ftp_host"
138  cu.ftp_username = "ftp_username"
139  cu.ftp_password = "ftp_password"
140  cu.archive_path = "bag_path"
141  t = CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename")
142  cu.upload_and_notify(t)
143  init.assert_called_with("ftp_host", "ftp_username", "ftp_password")
144  open.assert_called_with("bag_path/filename", 'rb')
145  quit.assert_called_once()
146  send.assert_called_once()
147  stor.assert_called_once()

152  @patch('ftplib.FTP.storbinary')

155  def testUploadAndNotifyWithoutEmail(self, init, open, stor, quit, send):
156  cu = CloudUploader()
157  RosNodeBase._recommended_missing = True
158  cu.ftp_host = "ftp_host"
159  cu.ftp_username = "ftp_username"

162  t = CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename")
163  cu.upload_and_notify(t)

171 
172  def ftp_socket_error(host, username, password):
173  e = socket.error()
174  e.errno = 111
175  e.strerror = "Connection refused"
176  raise e
177 
178  @staticmethod
179  def ftp_error_perm(host, username, password):
180  e = ftplib.error_perm("530-User cannot log in.")
181  raise e

183  ## Tests if the FTP errors are handled correctly by the upload function
184  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.formatted_log')
185  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.send_mail')
186  @patch('ftplib.FTP.quit')
187  @patch('ftplib.FTP.storbinary')
188  @patch('__builtin__.open')
189  @patch('ftplib.FTP.__init__', return_value = None, side_effect = ftp_socket_error)
190  def testUploadAndNotifyFtpErrors(self, init, open, stor, quit, send, log):
191  cu = CloudUploader()
192  RosNodeBase._recommended_missing = False
193  cu.ftp_host = "ftp_host"
194  cu.ftp_username = "ftp_username"
195  cu.ftp_password = "ftp_password"
196  cu.archive_path = "bag_path"
197  t = CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename")
198  # Wrong FTP host
199  cu.upload_and_notify(t)
200  stor.assert_not_called()
201  calls = [call('w', 'Cannot upload file: filename'), call('w', "<class 'socket.error'> [Errno 111] Connection refused")]
202  log.assert_has_calls(calls)
203  send.assert_called_once()
204 
205  # Wrong password or user name
206  init.side_effect = TestCloudUploader.ftp_error_perm
207  send.reset_mock()
208  log.reset_mock()
209  cu.upload_and_notify(t)
210  stor.assert_not_called()
211  calls = [call('w', 'Cannot upload file: filename'), call('w', "<class 'ftplib.error_perm'> 530-User cannot log in.")]
212  log.assert_has_calls(calls)
213  send.assert_called_once()

215  ## Tests if the UploadTask is created correctly
216  def testUploadTask(self):
217  ut = CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename")
218  assert ut.topic == "topic"
219  assert ut.value == "value"
220  assert ut.filename == "filename"
221 
222  def rospy_is_shutdown():
223  if TestCloudUploader.rospy_is_shutdown_first_run:
224  TestCloudUploader.rospy_is_shutdown_first_run = False
225  return False
226  else:
227  return True

229  ## Tests if the upload worker function works correctly
230  @patch('rospy.is_shutdown', side_effect = rospy_is_shutdown)
231  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.set_current_task')
232  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.upload_and_notify')
233  def testUploadWorker(self, upload, current, shutdown):
234  TestCloudUploader.rospy_is_shutdown_first_run = True
235  cu = CloudUploader()
236  cu.queue.put("test")
237  cu.currentTask = "current"
238  cu.upload_worker()
239  current.assert_has_calls([call(None), call("test")])
240  upload.assert_called_with("current")
241  assert shutdown.call_count == 2
242 
243  ## Tests if the upload callback function works properly
244  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.formatted_log')
245  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.UploadTask.__init__', return_value = None)
246  def testUploadCallback(self, init, log):
247  cu = CloudUploader()
248  data = UploadRequest()
249  data.topic = "topic"
250  data.value = "value"
251  data.filename = "filename"
252  resp = cu.upload_callback(data)
253  assert log.call_count == 1
254  assert log.call_args[0][0] == 'i'
255  assert log.call_args[0][1][0:28] == 'New task added to the queue:'
256  init.assert_called_with(data.topic, data.value, data.filename)
257  assert len(list(cu.queue.queue)) != 0
258  assert isinstance(resp, UploadResponse)
259 
260  ## Tests if the load callback function works properly
261  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.formatted_log')
262  @patch('ftplib.FTP.__init__', return_value = None)
263  @patch('ftplib.FTP.quit')
264  @patch('ftplib.FTP.retrbinary')
265  def testLoadCallbackSuccess(self, retr, quit, init, log):
266  cu = CloudUploader()
267  data = UploadRequest()
268  cu.ftp_host = "ftp_host"
269  cu.ftp_username = "ftp_username"
270  cu.ftp_password = "ftp_password"
271  cu.archive_path = "bag_path"
272  data.filename = "filename"
273  resp = cu.load_callback(data)
274  init.assert_called_with(cu.ftp_host, cu.ftp_username, cu.ftp_password)
275  retr.assert_called_once()
276  assert retr.call_args[0][0] == 'RETR filename'
277  assert isinstance(resp, UploadResponse)

279  ## Tests if the load callback function works properly if there is a socket error
280  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.formatted_log')
281  @patch('ftplib.FTP.__init__', return_value = None, side_effect = ftp_socket_error)
282  @patch('ftplib.FTP.quit')
283  @patch('ftplib.FTP.retrbinary')
284  def testLoadCallbackSocketError(self, retr, quit, init, log):
285  cu = CloudUploader()
286  data = UploadRequest()
287  cu.ftp_host = "ftp_host"
288  cu.ftp_username = "ftp_username"
289  cu.ftp_password = "ftp_password"
290  cu.archive_path = "bag_path"
291  data.filename = "filename"
292  resp = cu.load_callback(data)
293  init.assert_called_with(cu.ftp_host, cu.ftp_username, cu.ftp_password)
294  retr.assert_not_called()
295  log.assert_called_with('w', "<class 'socket.error'> [Errno 111] Connection refused")
296  assert isinstance(resp, UploadResponse)

298  ## Tests if the status publisher worker function works properly
299  @patch('rospy.is_shutdown', side_effect = rospy_is_shutdown)
300  @patch('rospy.Publisher.publish')
301  @patch('time.sleep')
302  def testStatusPubWorker(self, sleep, publish, shutdown):
303  TestCloudUploader.rospy_is_shutdown_first_run = True
304  cu = CloudUploader()
305  cu.status_publisher = Publisher("/test", UploadStatusList, queue_size = 0)
306  cu.queue.put(CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename"))
307  cu.queue.put(CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename2"))
308  cu.currentTask = CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename3")
309  cu.status_pub_worker()
310  assert shutdown.call_count == 2
311  publish.assert_called_once()
312  assert len(publish.call_args[0][0].statusList) == 3
313  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[0].file_name == "filename"
314  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[0].uploading == False
315  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[1].file_name == "filename2"
316  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[1].uploading == False
317  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[2].file_name == "filename3"
318  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[2].uploading == True
319  sleep.assert_called_once()
320 
321  ## Tests if the status publisher worker function works properly
322  @patch('rospy.is_shutdown', side_effect = rospy_is_shutdown)
323  @patch('rospy.Publisher.publish')
324  @patch('time.sleep')
325  def testStatusPubWorker2(self, sleep, publish, shutdown):
326  TestCloudUploader.rospy_is_shutdown_first_run = True
327  cu = CloudUploader()
328  cu.status_publisher = Publisher("/test", UploadStatusList, queue_size = 0)
329  cu.queue.put(CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename"))
330  cu.queue.put(CloudUploader.UploadTask("topic", "value", "filename2"))
331  cu.currentTask = None
332  cu.status_pub_worker()
333  assert shutdown.call_count == 2
334  publish.assert_called_once()
335  assert len(publish.call_args[0][0].statusList) == 2
336  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[0].file_name == "filename"
337  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[0].uploading == False
338  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[1].file_name == "filename2"
339  assert publish.call_args[0][0].statusList[1].uploading == False
340  sleep.assert_called_once()

342  ## Tests if the start function loads the config and starts the new threads before starting the spin
343  @patch('rospy.spin')
344  @patch('src.cloud_uploader.CloudUploader.load_config')
345  @patch('rospy.Service.__init__', return_value = None)
346  @patch('threading.Thread.__init__', return_value = None)
347  @patch('threading.Thread.start')
348  def testStart(self, thread, thread_start, service, load_config, spin):
349  cu = CloudUploader()
350  cu.start()
351  load_config.assert_called_once()
352  assert service.call_count == 2
353  service.call_args[0][0] == "/unnamed/upload"
354  assert thread.call_count == 2
355  assert thread_start.call_count == 2
356  spin.assert_called_once()
